Nightshift grins casually with a thumbs up.

" You got it Lord Elder, this =
time I got feet ta land on instead of tires.   And no more need'n spare tir=
es either.  No more flats, fender benders or rollovers.  From now on it's c=
limbing, skulking and prowling for me.  Of course for the benefit of my com=
rades.  And no more engines ta start up too.  Lov'n it, totally. "

He saun=
ters over to Wolfgang while back in beast mode, tail hung high and ears up =
and forward.  

" Okay here's what I can do.  Everything I hear will be tra=
nsmitted back ta you guys back in base.  I call it reverse audio transmissi=
on, sorta like a bug that's planted somewhere in spy missions but, mobile. =
 I wont say a word but I will transmit in silent com.  You'll get my messag=
es via text.  This way those ugly mugs don't know what the slag they're in =
for.  And little old me be'n as black as I am, will totally go unnoticed if=
 I keep ta dense vegetation or deeply shadowed areas.  Trust me, ain't no o=
ne gonna be look'n real hard for someone who seems not ta be totally there.=
"

He hands Lord Elder his transmit code.

" If ya need ta call me, use thi=
s number.  Remember, text messages only."


Don't be envious of what you do=
n't have, be grateful for things you already posses.  Nothing is worth more=
 than family and friends.

On Nov 9, 2011, at 2:32 PM, Super Cyclonus <supe=
rcyclonus@...> wrote:

> > <OLD>
> >
> > Nightshift pauses and gets i=
nto his robot mode, which appears more slender
> > than before, due to his =
beast mode. He looks to Lord Elder and cracks his
> > knuckles.
> >
> > " T=
hat just means we gotta do business old school style. Could swing some
> > =
serious recon out on the field and score the intel we need. I can reverb
> =
> that back ta you guys, and you decide our next move based on what I find.=

> > Special ops is someth'n I've been trained in extensively. And it sound=
s
> > like ya need a spy in your corner."
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> There was a nod a=
nd a small smile from LORD ELDER, "Yes, that is why I
> called you here. Yo=
u will go with Polar Claw here" ELDER gestured at
> POLAR CLAW, "and the re=
st of his team, and you will go find out what
> is going on and fix it if y=
ou can."
> 
> POLAR CLAW nodded, "The shuttle has been repaired and energiz=
ed for
> the trip." He said his deep tones.
> 
> PROWL, who was standing ne=
xt to POLAR CLAW glanced up, "Yes, we can
> use all the hands we can get. W=
e have no idea what's going on down
> there."
> 
> WOLFGANG and RAMULUS als=
o stood at the ready, WOLFGANG grinning, "Back
> into the saddle again he?"=
 He said to NIGHTSHIFT.
> 
> "I hope it turns out better than last time." R=
AMULUS said only half jokingly.
> 
> ELDER smiled, "Good." He said rubbing =
his hands together. "Legacy has
> fed the coordinates into the shuttle's na=
vigation systems."
> 
> He turned to look at POLAR CLAW and NIGHTSHIFT, "be=
 as quick as you
> can, and we will be awaiting any word." He shrugged slig=
htly, "Unlike
> those in the jungle area the com systems appears to be work=
ing. So
> keep in contact."
> 
> He glanced at NIGHTSHIFT, "And Bump will b=
e here should we have any
> injuries." He smiled as he said that, trying to=
 lighten the mood with
> humor.
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> Preston
>

s up.</div><div><br></div><div>" You got it Lord Elder, this time I got fee=
t ta land on instead of tires.   And no more need'n spare tires either=
.  No more flats, fender benders or rollovers.  From now on it's =
climbing, skulking and prowling for me.  Of course for the benefit of =
my comrades.  And no more engines ta start up too.  Lov'n it, tot=
ally. "</div><div><br></div><div>He saunters over to Wolfgang while back in=
 beast mode, tail hung high and ears up and forward.  </div><div><br><=
/div><div>" Okay here's what I can do.  Everything I hear will be tran=
smitted back ta you guys back in base.  I call it reverse audio transm=
ission, sorta like a bug that's planted somewhere in spy missions but, mobi=
le.  I wont say a word but I will transmit in silent com.  You'll=
 get my messages via text.  This way those ugly mugs don't know what t=
he slag they're in for.  And little old me be'n as black as I am, will=
 totally go unnoticed if I keep ta dense vegetation or deeply shadowed area=
s.  Trust me, ain't no one gonna be look'n real hard for someone who s=
eems not ta be totally there."</div><div><br></div><div>He hands Lord Elder=
 his transmit code.</div><div><br></div><div>" If ya need ta call me, use t=

ady posses.  Nothing is worth more than family and friends.</div><div>=

ch appears more slender<br>

oks to Lord Elder and cracks his<br>

gt; serious recon out on the field and score the intel we need.  I can reve=

y.  And it sounds<br>

There was a nod and a small smile from LORD ELDER, "Yes, =
that is why I<br>
called you here. You will go with Polar Claw here" ELDER =
gestured at<br>
POLAR CLAW, "and the rest of his team, and you will go find=
 out what<br>
is going on and fix it if you can."<br>
<br>
POLAR CLAW nodde=
d, "The shuttle has been repaired and energized for<br>
the trip." He said =
his deep tones.<br>
<br>
PROWL, who was standing next to POLAR CLAW glanced=
 up, "Yes, we can<br>
use all the hands we can get. We have no idea what's =
going on down<br>
there."<br>
<br>
WOLFGANG and RAMULUS also stood at the r=
eady, WOLFGANG grinning, "Back<br>
into the saddle again he?" He said to NI=
GHTSHIFT.<br>
<br>
"I hope it turns out better than last time." RAMULUS sai=
d only half jokingly.<br>
<br>
ELDER smiled, "Good." He said rubbing his ha=
nds together. "Legacy has<br>
fed the coordinates into the shuttle's naviga=
tion systems."<br>
<br>
He turned to look at POLAR CLAW and NIGHTSHIFT, "be=
 as quick as you<br>
can, and we will be awaiting any word." He shrugged sl=
ightly, "Unlike<br>
those in the jungle area the com systems appears to be =
working. So<br>
keep in contact."<br>
<br>
He glanced at NIGHTSHIFT, "And B=
ump will be here should we have any<br>
injuries." He smiled as he said tha=
t, trying to lighten the mood with<br>
humor.<br>
